title: Unveiling Attractor Cycles in Large Language Models: A Dynamical Systems View of Successive Paraphrasing
author: Zhilin Wang (Shanghai AI Laboratory), Yafu Li (Shanghai AI Laboratory), Jianhao Yan (Zhejiang University), Yu Cheng (Chinese University of Hong Kong), Yue Zhang (Westlake University), ...
relevance_why: The study's exploration of attractor cycles in language models could provide insights into generative processes relevant to audio and music processing, especially regarding text-to-audio generation methodologies.
background: The paper examines how large language models, through successive paraphrasing, can demonstrate cyclical behavior in text generation, resembling dynamical systems with stable configurations.
contribution: This paper introduces the concept of attractor cycles in Large Language Models (LLMs) to analyze successive paraphrasing, achieving insights into the generative properties of these models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous approaches focused on single-instance performance of language models in generating paraphrases and often overlooked inherent repetitive behaviors.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically investigates the iterative nature of LLMs, revealing stable periodic outputs rather than widely varied paraphrases.

key_innovation: The synthesis of dynamical systems theory with language generation provides a unique framework for understanding the convergence behavior of LLMs during iterative transformations.
real_world_impact: Understanding the limitations imposed by attractor cycles can inform improved architectures and training strategies for language models, enhancing their utility in applications such as generative audio and text diversity.
limitations: The study notes potential constraints in generalizing findings to more complex prompts or different models of LLMs.

new_terms.attractor cycle: **Attractor cycle** refers to a closed trajectory in a dynamical system to which the system eventually converges, indicating repetitive behavior.
new_terms.successive paraphrasing: **Successive paraphrasing** is the iterative process in which a model continuously rephrases its outputs while attempting to maintain the original meaning.
